DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Fixation Time Unit of Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure associated with the numerical quantity which captures the length of time it takes for chemical preservation of a biospecimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.:The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/24/22 jk MCL Biospecimen CSI removed; if reused in future ownership should be transferred. 10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.  9/12/19 jk created for MCL Biospecimen tracking.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.definition: Any period of seven consecutive days.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
